section: However, either Joint Venturer may unilaterally terminate the agreement with written notice of sixty (60) days.
explanation: This contradicts the previous sentence stating the agreement is effective until February 28, 2004, 'unless extended by written agreement'. The ability to unilaterally terminate with 60 days' notice undermines the fixed term ending date, creating ambiguity about the actual duration of the joint venture.

section: Notwithstanding the foregoing, PVSS shall be entitled to receive a guaranteed payment of $10,000 per month, regardless of the Joint Venture's profitability.
explanation: Section 9 discusses distributions of gross income to the joint venturers based on their prorata interest, but this overrides it by guaranteeing PVSS a payment of $10,000 per month. This creates inconsistency in the distribution of income, especially if there's insufficient gross income to cover both prorata distributions and this payment.

section: However, in the event of a dispute regarding the valuation of assets during liquidation, Collectible Concepts Group, Inc. will have the final say on the asset's value.
explanation: This gives CCGI unilateral power in determining the value of assets during liquidation. This is not structured properly as the legal terms do not make sense as the other party has no recourse if they do not agree with the valuation of the assets.
